questions.question_text: Which two site-to-site tunnel-based VPN technologies support routing, multicast and private IP addressing? (Choose two.)
You are deploying a new network that requires routing protocols that support TLVs and Fast Reroute. Which two routing protocols must you use? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
C and D

Prerequisites for Loop-Free Alternate Fast Reroute

Any of the following protocols must be supported for Loop-Free Alternate Fast Reroute:
Intermediate System-to-Intermediate System (IS-IS)
Open Shortest Path First (OSPF)

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/ios-xml/ios/iproute_pi/configuration/xe-3s/asr903/iri-xe-3s-asr903-book/iri-lfa-frr.html

EIGRP and IS-IS support TLVs. (which is why they were the first to support IPv6 routing).
Can't comment on fast reroute.

choices.D: You can change the minimum and maximum TTL
choices.B: You can change the datagram size to troubleshoot clocking problems on serial lines.
choices.C: You can use the Strict IP header option
choices.A: You can change the source port that the UDP probe messages use.
choices.E: You can use the Verbose IP header option to specify the IP address of each hop that the packet takes.

questions.question_text: Which two statements about extended traceroute options are true? (Choose two.)

comments.content:
Yes, C D.

"IP header options. This prompt offers more than one option to be selected. They are:
Verbose is automatically selected along with any other option.
Record is a very useful option because it displays the address(es) of the hops (up to nine) the packet goes through.
Loose allows you to influence the path by specifying the address(es) of the hop(s) you want the packet to go through.
Strict is used to specify the hop(s) that you want the packet to go through, but no other hop(s) are allowed to be visited.
Timestamp is used to measure roundtrip time to particular hosts"

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/ip/routing-information-protocol-rip/13730-ext-ping-trace.html

discussion.content:
you can only change dest Port:

Port Number [33434]: The destination port used by the UDP probe messages. The default is 33434.

correct should :

Minimum Time to Live [1]: The TTL value for the first probes. The default is 1, but it can be set to a higher value to suppress the display of known hops.
Maximum Time to Live [30]: The largest TTL value that can be used. The default is 30. The traceroute command terminates when the destination is reached or when this value is reached

Loose, Strict, Record, Timestamp, Verbose[none]: IP header options. You can specify any combination. The traceroute command issues prompts for the required fields. Note that the traceroute command will place the requested options in each probe; however, there is no guarantee that all routers (or end nodes) will process the options.

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/ip/routing-information-protocol-rip/13730-ext-ping-trace.html#ext_troute

choices.A: add rotary 33 to the VTY lines
choices.D: remove transport input telnet from the VTY lines
choices.B: add access-list 101 deny tcp any any eq 23 to the ACL
choices.C: remove authorization exec ITCC from the VTY lines

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. Your company's security policy requires you to allow telnet access using tcp port 3033 only. You apply the configuration changes as shown and then test. Your telnet attempt fails. Which action would correct the issue?

discussion.content: Add rotary 33 is the correct answer

choices.A: The router memory needs to be upgraded
choices.C: The Rommon firmware needs to be updated
choices.B: The router IOS needs to be updated

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. Your client has asked you to replace telnet access with SSH and the configuration has failed. What is the root cause of this issue?

discussion.content:
Yes, B

"Cisco 2801 IOS Enterprise Services w/o Crypto
Enterprise Services W/O Crypto
c2801-entservices-mz"

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/ios/12_4/12_4x/release/notes/rn2800xj.html (see Table 1)
